info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:40PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Twin Falls and southeastern Owyhee Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 340 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Middle Butte, or 22 miles north of Jarbidge, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Black Butte and Horse Butte around 350 PM MDT. Coonskin Butte and Roseworth around 400 PM MDT. Castleford around 410 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
